alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Harvey; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 9:48AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Harvey, Chase, northwestern Butler and southeastern Marion Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 948 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Marion to 5 miles northwest of Whitewater. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, El Dorado, Augusta, Marion, Towanda, Peabody, Cottonwood Falls, Benton, Whitewater, Florence, Potwin, Walton, Elbing, Burns, Bazaar, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Newton Airport and Wonsevu. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 29 and 31. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 61 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
